p: Without integrating urbanization and adaptation, we observed a predominant increasing trend in the YLLs for the three future periods under all RCP scenarios and the majority of 27 GCMs, although there were large variations in YLLs among GCMs. The increments of YLLs were more rapid under the RCP4.5 and RCP8.5 scenarios compared with the RCP2.6 scenario. For the total population, the annual heat-related YLLs in the 2030s, 2060s, and 2090s were 1.6, 2.4, and 2.5 thousand, respectively, under RCP2.6, and the corresponding figures were 2.2, 7.0, and 11.4 thousand, respectively, under RCP8.5 compared with the baseline range ( Figure 3 and Figure S6).
